content.description: This is an all trad climb that goes up a dihedral/gully past a small pine tree to a vegetated ledge.  Then it goes up a face to another vegetated gully to the money part of the climb.  The money part involves perfect but easy lieback moves that protect well throughout to another small ledge.  Then you do the crux moves up a face with pulling on a hold to the left to a big ledge.  You need to walk/climb about 30 to 40 back on the ledge to find good anchor placements.  Don't be fooled by the vegetated lower parts as the lieback moves up higher are really good.
content.protection: You will need Camalot type cams from 1.0 through 4.0 (4.0 helpful at the crux), a set of Alien-type cams from 0.30" to 2".  Bring some long slings as the route moves around a bit.
content.location: This route is about 75-100' right of "Baby Bear" on the left side of the east face of Punk Dome.  It starts at a block that has a distinct 3" to 6" crack running through it with a very small juniper tree nearby.  The coordinates are N 37.08134 and W 118.95726.  To get down you must do 3rd and 4th class down climbing on ledges to the climber's right to reach the bolted rappel chains for "Baby Bear" and the other climbs.

content.description: Papa Bear is the leftmost route on the East Face of Punk Rock.  Ascend the clean face past some small knobs to a right and upward trending under-cling.  Pull over the flake where easiest and straight up the face to a single chain anchor backed up with a bolt with sling and screw link
content.location: East Face of Punk Rock.  At the base is a flat staging area and 3 grouped trees.

content.description: Mama Bear starts on the slab below a slight downward facing flake and climbs sustained friction to a 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: South end of the East Face of Punk Rock.  First bolt is about 15 feet up after you pull into a scoop below a slight fold in the rock.  Lower with a 70 m is safest

content.description: Baby Bear is the rightmost route at the 64th Birthday area and begins by climbing a thin flake to it's end, then stepping out and climbing the friction face to another cam or tricam placement in a knob inclusion and then 2 more bolts to the chains
content.protection:
Single set of small cams from Blue Metolius to orange Metolius; 5 Quick draws and 4 long slings.

A yellow Metolius or equivalent tricam fits in the knob inclusion.  You need a set of brass tapered nuts or RP's.  I used a #2 RP set sideways at the apex of the thin crack.
content.location:
South end of East face of Punk Rock.

Same area as Mama Bear but 30 ft. to the right beginning on an easy move up a thin flake which steepens and gets thinner.  Best to lower with a 70m if the belayer is standing back.
